summary: This memo discusses the return of Balume N. Hidalgo, Jr. to the CIA and queries whether to check with the State Department before approving a security certification, noting Hidalgo's past as an FBI informant and State's previous reluctance to integrate him in 1957.
summary_one_paragraph: An office memorandum dated December 2, 1958, from (Chen)03 to De/PSD addresses the return of Balume N. Hidalgo, Jr. to the CIA and a request for security approval for a State-Certification of Subject for a temporary assignment to San Salvador. The memo notes that Hidalgo's file is non-derogatory but points out the State Department's previous reluctance to consider him for integration in 1957 due to his history as a former FBI informant. The memo questions whether to consult with the State Department before approving the certification for this temporary assignment.
title: Hidalgo, Balume N. Jr. RETURN TO CIA
